Nightshift looks to Nightlight with a smile.  He could see that she was hol=
ding onto those memories as he suggested.  Gradually his damages were being=
 repaired and he could now shift his position a little more easily.  Still =
his servos were quite stiff from the side impact trauma he endured in his v=
ehicle form.  

" Master Yokitron did say that fate had strange ways of det=
ermining one's future and that no matter what we do, there's no way we can =
alter it's course.  He was right.  No matter what happens now, fate is alwa=
ys gonna be the deciding factor on how things pan out from now on.  No one =
can predict what's gonna happen, and whatever happens all we gotta do is ro=
ll with situations as they come up.  I think Tucson Prime's aware of that b=
ut I know he wants ta fight the odds.  Even before he got promoted, he's al=
ways been like that.  He wants freedom and peace for this planet and for us=
, and he's not gonna back down until he gets what he wants.  I only wish he=
'd save a little something for himself, he's always think'n of us before he=
 thinks of himself.  I dunno about everyone else but, I don't wanna lose hi=
m.  He's one of the best friends, soldiers and friends we got on our side. =
 I just don't think he realizes that and he should."

He heaves a sigh whil=
e continuing his repair session.

Perpetually on the move and constantly bu=
sy. 

On Jul 23, 2011, at 2:27 AM, Airshadow Nightstar <airly2002@hotmail.c=
om> wrote:

>  
> Nightlight smiled remembering all the happy=
 moments that she had shared with her husband and daughter

 of good times and moments spent with the one ya love."

 the move and constantly busy.

>> 
>> Nightshift smiles and gently holds Nightlight's hand.
>>  
>> " A=
nd don't ever let anyone take that away from ya.  Love is more valuable tha=
n energon and it lasts forever.  There's plenty of that here alright, lets =
hope we can hold inta that for a long time. "
>>  
>> He shifts his positio=
n on the repair bench.
>>  
>> " This sure reminds me of Ratchet's med bay.=
  I must've ended up there so many times that I lost count.  But it wasn't =
for stupid reasons, usually because of freak ambush attempts by Decepticon =
speedsters.  I sure hated those guys, I wasn't as fast as they were and the=
y knew it.  So of course they'd always chose me as their target.  Ratchet w=
as aware of that, and he never got agitated when I came in.  But what was w=
orse, I'd never hear the end of it from Sunstreaker and Sideswipe.  Slag, t=
hose two were always rank'n on me.  But I tried ta ignore 'em.  Then one da=
y, Ohh this is sweet, one day it happened again and I wound back up in Ratc=
het's office. Tucson was mak'n a delivery of supplies before he got shot bl=
ind, and those two were pull'n their scrap on me.  Well, not only did he he=
ar them, he saw them do'n it and slag, you didn't wanna be around Tucson th=
at time, because he had the look of destruction in his eyes.  Now mind ya, =
they knew better not ta scrap around with him because he'd slag 'em real go=
od if they did.  All they had ta do was look into his optics and they turne=
d around and apologized ta me without a single word outa Tucson's mouth.  A=
fter that, it never happened again."
>>  
>> He sighs gently.
>>  
>> " Hap=
py ta say that there was never any ridicule ever said about anyone after th=
at.  Optimus was glad about that, so he let Tucson's temper slide somewhat.=
  It kept the speedsters in line and guys like us, Hound, Trail Breaker, an=
d Beach Comber were happy not ta get ranked on because of our lack of speed=
.  And definitely no one ever messed with Ratchet.  Ohh no, that was consid=
ered taboo.  Maan I sure miss those times."
>> 
>> Perpetually on the move =
and constantly busy.
>>

r <airly2002@...> wrote:

>>> Nightshift turns his head to Nightlight and reaches out to=
 put a friendly hand on hers, to show his support.
>>>  
>>> " It's okay, B=
ump knows what he's do'n.  In no time you'll be back on your feet bust'n Pr=
edacon and Decepticon aft from here back ta Cybertron.  And none of those j=
okers are gonna think twice about mess'n      with you again. You got somet=
h'n they don't have, and never will have, a      good spark in you spark ch=
amber."
>>>  
>>> He then lies back in his repair chamber.
>>>  
>>> " Rodi=
mus is real lucky ta have someone like you in his life.  I never got the ch=
ance ta find someone back home.  Always too many things go'n on and no time=
 for relationships.  If I could tell the other Autobots someth'n I'd tell t=
hem ta enjoy the little things in life, the simple pleasures it has ta offe=
r.  Because if ya don't enjoy them while you're alive, you'll never get the=
 chance again after you're gone." 
>>> 
>>> Perpetually on the move and con=
stantly busy.
>>>

ggested.  Gradually his damages were being repaired and he could now s=
hift his position a little more easily.  Still his servos were quite s=
tiff from the side impact trauma he endured in his vehicle form.  </di=
v><div><br></div><div>" Master Yokitron did say that fate had strange ways =
of determining one's future and that no matter what we do, there's no way w=
e can alter it's course.  He was right.  No matter what happens n=
ow, fate is always gonna be the deciding factor on how things pan out from =
now on.  No one can predict what's gonna happen, and whatever happens =
all we gotta do is roll with situations as they come up.  I think Tucs=
on Prime's aware of that but I know he wants ta fight the odds.  Even =
before he got promoted, he's always been like that.  He wants freedom =
and peace for this planet and for us, and he's not gonna back down until he=

self, he's always think'n of us before he thinks of himself.  I dunno =
about everyone else but, I don't wanna lose him.  He's one of the best=
